content: Dr Xi Wang | Computer Science | The University of Sheffield Skip to main content Search sheffield.ac.uk Close menu × School of Computer Science School of Computer Science Menu Dr Xi Wang School of Computer Science Lecturer Course Director for MSc Computer Science with Speech & Language Processing Open staff member portrait in a modal window xi.wang@sheffield.ac.uk Regent Court (DCS) Full contact details Dr Xi Wang School of Computer Science Regent Court (DCS) 211 Portobello Sheffield S1 4DP Orcid ID:0000-0001-5936-9919 Google Scholar Personal webpage Profile Xi Wang is a Lecturer of Natural Language Processing at the University of Sheffield. Previously, he obtained his PhD from the University of Glasgow, supervised by Prof. Iadh Ounis and Prof. Craig Macdonald and focused on the research topic of developing review text-based recommender systems. After that, he joined the web intelligence group of University College London (UCL) as a postdoctoral researcher, supervised by Prof. Emine Yilmaz and worked on knowledge-augmented task-oriented dialogue systems. His current research interests are conversational AI, personalisation, and retrieval augmented generation, fairness, as well as relevant topics in the domain of natural language processing (NLP).
